messages.title: ELECTION ADDRESS
messages.content: It is a huge privilege to serve Birkenhead in Parliament. If I am fortunate enough to be returned as our town’s MP, I pledge that amongst other goals I will:

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Deliver a first-class service to the residents of Birkenhead
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Continue to serve Birkenhead, our country, and the true values of the Labour Party to the best of my abilities.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Always put the interests of Birkenhead and the country first
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Vote against unfair settlement agreements and continue to serve the interests of Birkenhead first.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Campaign for a new, fully funded National Health and Social Care Service
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Provide the necessary demands and adequate resources to serve those in need.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Fight for greater investment in education from pregnancy onwards
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Campaign for greater investment in education at all ages to improve the life chances of disadvantaged children.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Work with local businesses to attract investment and create jobs
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Enable local businesses to create jobs that pay good wages and provide the chance for apprenticeships that will give them the skills they need to earn a decent living.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Push for more affordable housing and an end to homelessness
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ensure people in our area gain access to new and existing homes and receive the help they need to avoid homelessness.
Reduce costs and ensure that everyone receives the right compensation.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Lead the national effort against low pay and unfair working practices
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Combat modern yawning disparities in wages and working conditions.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Continue to lead the fightback against hunger and destitution
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support initiatives providing meals and establish new supermarkets serving the locals.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Drive international action against climate change, modern slavery, and financial crime
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Promote global economic reforms and stringent laws to curb exploitative practices, financial crime and environmental harm.

issues.brexitEurope: I believe our country is better off working with Europe rather than isolating ourselves.
issues.economy: Enable businesses to grow, provide jobs, and end financial crime.
issues.education: Investing in education from early age and continuing the fight for better educational resources
issues.environment: Climate change action and promoting renewable initiatives.
issues.health: Provide a new, fully funded National Health and Social Care Service.
issues.labourEmployment: Attract investment, create jobs, provide apprenticeships, fight against low pay.
issues.socialWelfare: Fight homelessness, provide meals, establish new local supermarkets.

community.content: Ensure people have access to progressive National Insurance system to fund a new National Health and Social Care Service.

examples: Campaign for greater investment in education at all ages.
Provide the necessary resources for the new National Insurance system.
Fight against homelessness and improve housing.
Create local jobs and provide apprenticeships.
Campaign for new National Health and Social Care Service.
Drive international action against climate change.
